item.title: Daryl add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "Do you know when they say soulmates? Everybody uses it in personal ads. “Soul mate wanted.” It doesn’t mean too much now. But soulmates – think about it. When your soul – whatever that is anyway – something so alive when you make music or love and so mysteriously hidden most of the rest of the time, so colorful and big but without color or shape – when your soul finds another soul it can recognize even before the rest of you knows about it. The rest of you just feels sweaty and jumpy at first. And your souls get married without even meaning to – even if you can’t be together for some reason in real life, your souls just go ahead and make the wedding plans. A soul’s wedding must be too beautiful to even look at. It must be blinding. It must be like all the weddings in the world – gondolas with canopies of doves, champagne glasses shattering, wings of veils, drums beating, flutes and trumpets, showers of roses. And after that happens you know – that’s it. This is it." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Francesca Lia Block
item.description: "It's important to tell your story. It's important to listen." -- Francesca Lia Block

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Take the Kama Sutra. How many people died from the Kama Sutra as opposed to the Bible? Who wins?" -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Art is making something out of nothing, and selling it." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Drop out of school before your mind rots from exposure to our mediocre educational system. Forget about the Senior Prom and go to the library and educate yourself if you've got any guts. Some of you like Pep rallies and plastic robots who tell you what to read." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Communism doesn't work because people like to own stuff." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "A drug is not bad. A drug is a chemical compound. The problem comes in when people who take drugs treat them like a license to behave like an asshole." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "I have an important message to deliver to all the cute people all over the world. If you're out there and you're cute, maybe you're beautiful. I just want to tell you somethin' — there's more of us UGLY MOTHERFUCKERS than you are, hey-y, so watch out." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "My best advice to anyone who wants to raise a happy, mentally healthy child is: Keep him or her as far away from a church as you can." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Drugs will turn you into your parents." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Some scientists claim that hydrogen, because it is so plentiful, is the basic building block of the universe. I dispute that. I say there is more stupidity than hydrogen, and that is the basic building block of the universe." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "A true Zen saying: "Nothing is what I want." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "The most important thing to do in your life is to not interfere with somebody else's life." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "How wonderful to know someone who was bad and dishonorable and a cheat and a liar, when all the world was filled with people who would not lie to save their souls and who would rather starve than do a dishonorable deed!" -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "She could see so clearly now that he was only a childish fancy, no more important really than her spoiled desire for the aquamarine earbobs she had coaxed out of Gerald. For, once she owned the earbobs, they had lost their value, as everything except money lost its value once it was hers. " -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "I won’t think of it now. I’ll think of it later when I can stand it." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "She couldn't survey the wreck of the world with an air of casual unconcern." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Daryl add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "She saw in his eyes defeat of her wild dreams, her mad desires." -- Margaret Mitchell
